required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Esomeprazole Once Daily for the Treatment of GERD in Neonatal Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled, Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Esomeprazole Once Daily for the Treatment of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD) in Neonatal Patients, Including Premature and up to 1 Month Corrected Age

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the difference between esomeprazole and placebo in the treatment of signs and symptoms as observed by 8-hour video and cardiorespiratory monitoring in neonatal patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalized Number of GERD Events Observed From Video and Cardiorespiratory Monitoring
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
primary_outcome.description: The number of events are normalized prior to summary to correspond to a complete 8-hour monitoring period. Only patients with data at both baseline and final assessment are included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Normalized Number of GERD Events During Video and Cardiorespiratory Monitoring Associated With Acid Reflux
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Event considered associated with reflux if start time of GERD sign/symptom is within 2 minutes of start time of acid reflux. The number of events are normalized prior to summary to correspond to a complete 8-hour monitoring period. Only patients with data at both baseline and final assessment are included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Reflux Episodes (Acid or Non-acid)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Acidic Reflux Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH<4.0) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Weakly Acidic Reflux Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH 4.0-6.9) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Non Acidic Reflux Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes (pH>=7.0) based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Liquid Acidic Reflux Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Mixed Gas/Liquid Acidic Reflux Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reflux episodes based on 24-hour impedance monitoring data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Bolus Clearance Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Acid Clearance Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage Time With pH<4.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage time with pH<4 during 24-hour pH monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage Time With pH Within 4.0-6.9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (10-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage time with pH 4.0-6.9 during 24-hour pH monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Full-term or gestational age >/= 28 to 44 weeks
- In-patient in Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, special care nursery, or equivalent
- Patient must be on a stable mode of feeding or with minimal variations for at least 2 days prior to randomization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a need for resectional or reconstructive surgery of the gastrointestinal tract
- Patients with any condition that may require surgery during the course of the study
- Patients with acute respiratory distress within 72 hours prior to enrollment

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants either full term or those with a gestational age or post-conceptual age ³28 to 44 weeks, and who were inpatients suspected of having the following clinical findings: any 2 (either individually or in any combination) of (1) apnea +/- bradycardia +/- oxygen desaturations, (2) vomiting/gagging, (3) irritability/pain at least every second

group.title: Esomeprazole
group.description: Esomeprazole 0.5 mg/kg/ day once daily 30 minutes prior to a morning feeding during 15 days by oral gavage (using a nasogastric or orogastric tube) or by nippling.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo once daily 30 minutes prior to a morning feeding during 15 days by oral gavage (using a nasogastric or orogastric tube) or by nippling.

participants_list.participants: ITT population. One voluntary discontinuation by parent/guardian

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
